column4: Is there a apt-remove-repositoty command or is is safe to manually remove the repository file in /etc/apt/sources.d/ ?
Seems weird that there is no command to remove repositories.
if you want to remove a PPA and downgrade packages, use the 'ppa-purge' utility (install it with apt-get)
Okay, but I think ppa-purge should be installed by default.
